term.title: desorption (by displacement)

item.text: The process in which expulsion of a previously adsorbed component from the interfacial layer is effected by subsequent stronger adsorption of another component.

sources.item: PAC, 1972, 31, 577. 'Manual of Symbols and Terminology for Physicochemical Quantities and Units, Appendix II: Definitions, Terminology and Symbols in Colloid and Surface Chemistry' on page 585 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac197231040577)

term.citation: Citation: 'desorption (by displacement)' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.D01621

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
